paradox_name.en: Symptom Treatment vs Root Cause Neglect
paradox_name.id: Pengobatan Gejala vs Pengabaian Akar Masalah

description.en: 80 billion IDR spent on dredging sediment (symptom) while only 45 billion on upstream watershed restoration (root cause), despite knowing deforestation drives sedimentation
description.id: 80 miliar IDR dihabiskan untuk pengerukan sedimen (gejala) sementara hanya 45 miliar untuk restorasi DAS hulu (akar masalah), meskipun mengetahui deforestasi menyebabkan sedimentasi

evidence_summary: BWS emergency dredging removes sediment that returns within 2-3 years; BPDAS reforestation addresses cause but receives 44% less budget and slower implementation

description.en: Government provides 25 billion for rice field expansion in receding lake areas, directly subsidizing permanent lake disappearance and fisher displacement
description.id: Pemerintah memberikan 25 miliar untuk perluasan sawah di area danau yang surut, langsung mensubsidi penghilangan danau permanen dan perpindahan nelayan

evidence_summary: Ministry of Agriculture funds agricultural conversion of seasonal lake zones; DLH documents 30% lake area loss but no coordination with agriculture subsidies accelerating the destruction

paradox_name.en: KJA Expansion vs Traditional Fisher Displacement
paradox_name.id: Ekspansi KJA vs Perpindahan Nelayan Tradisional

description.en: Government subsidizes KJA expansion (35B) that displaces traditional Bugis fishers who receive minimal support (8B), destroying indigenous fishing livelihoods
description.id: Pemerintah mensubsidi ekspansi KJA (35M) yang menggusur nelayan tradisional Bugis yang menerima dukungan minimal (8M), menghancurkan mata pencaharian nelayan adat

evidence_summary: Ministry of Marine Affairs promotes floating cage aquaculture with subsidies and technical support; traditional fishers report catch decline and displacement but receive 77% less budget

paradox_name.en: Indigenous Governance Exclusion Despite Centuries of Lake Management
paradox_name.id: Pengecualian Tata Kelola Adat Meskipun Berabad-abad Mengelola Danau

description.en: Bugis Traditional Council (To Manurung) has governed Lake Tempe fishing for centuries with customary law, but receives zero budget allocation and no formal role in modern governance
description.id: Dewan Adat Bugis (To Manurung) telah mengatur perikanan Danau Tempe selama berabad-abad dengan hukum adat, tetapi menerima alokasi anggaran nol dan tidak ada peran formal dalam tata kelola modern

evidence_summary: Traditional authority maintained sustainable fishing practices pre-modern interventions; now excluded from Forum Koordinasi decision-making despite 5,000+ fishing families under their customary governance

description.en: DLH documents 30% lake area shrinkage (13,000 ha to 9,100 ha) with quarterly monitoring, yet no enforcement to halt agricultural conversion or KJA expansion
description.id: DLH mendokumentasikan penyusutan area danau 30% (13.000 ha menjadi 9.100 ha) dengan monitoring triwulanan, namun tidak ada penegakan untuk menghentikan konversi pertanian atau ekspansi KJA

evidence_summary: Provincial environmental office publishes annual reports showing lake crisis, satellite imagery confirms permanent loss, but no authority to enforce spatial planning or revoke conversion permits

paradox_name.en: Traditional Knowledge Exclusion Despite Scientific Validation
paradox_name.id: Pengecualian Pengetahuan Tradisional Meskipun Validasi Ilmiah

description.en: Hasanuddin University research validates traditional fisher ecological knowledge, yet fisher observations remain excluded from formal monitoring systems
description.id: Penelitian Universitas Hasanuddin memvalidasi pengetahuan ekologis nelayan tradisional, namun pengamatan nelayan tetap dikecualikan dari sistem monitoring formal

evidence_summary: UNHAS research shows traditional fishers accurately predict seasonal fish migrations and water quality changes; Forum Nelayan maintains daily catch logs, but BWS and DLH never integrate this data despite 0 IDR cost to access

description.en: 20 billion IDR spent removing water hyacinth that returns within months, while nutrient pollution (root cause) from KJA and agriculture remains unaddressed
description.id: 20 miliar IDR dihabiskan untuk menghilangkan eceng gondok yang kembali dalam beberapa bulan, sementara polusi nutrisi (akar masalah) dari KJA dan pertanian tetap tidak ditangani

evidence_summary: Manual and mechanical hyacinth removal treats surface symptom; TSI increase from 62 to 78 (2020-2024) shows nutrient loading accelerates but no KJA feed controls or agricultural runoff management implemented

description.en: Forum Koordinasi Danau Tempe established for multi-stakeholder coordination but receives minimal budget (5B) and no authority to enforce integrated decisions
description.id: Forum Koordinasi Danau Tempe dibentuk untuk koordinasi multi-pihak tetapi menerima anggaran minimal (5M) dan tidak ada kewenangan untuk menegakkan keputusan terpadu

evidence_summary: Forum mediates conflicts between fishers, farmers, KJA operators but cannot compel BWS, BPDAS, or Ministry of Agriculture to coordinate budgets or halt contradictory interventions; 233B IDR allocated to sector agencies with zero coordination requirement
